comment: Poor/random grading standards. If you don't agree with the material, being LGBT, class will be hell. Doesn't take correction or input from students. However grades are based on 3 papers, so it's an easy A. So long as you play along, ignore the cringe, and don't ever say a word to her, you should be fine.

She assigns textbook readings but then provides you with a synopsis of the reading several classes later. Everything builds on itself, she has you turn in smaller assignments leading up to papers, and peer editing is a grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The workload was pretty light, but this teacher has no idea what she's doing. I am genuinely surprised his score is this high. She clearly is pushing an agenda with her topics and if your view contradict hers things will be harder for you. She is all over the place when grading or giving feedback. She gets defensive if you pint out her mistakes.

You don't really need to buy the book unless you plan on doing a lot of writing later on. She discusses everything you'll be doing in class & explains things well. The topics in the class are bearable & even fun at times. She knows a lot about writing, &  I actually learned something in the class.

Took her for 1101 & 02. 7 papers for both smstrs. Rubrics are clear & concise, she's a very reasonable grader & she keeps the project topics interesting. You wont write the same paper I did. And to the person complaining about her speed grading papers last semester: we almost lost her as a teacher due to illness. I'm impressed she did what she did.

Pros: fair grader, relatively light workload, only 4 papers done.  Cons: took her all semester to grade essays 2-4, so no one knew how they were actually doing in class. Huge problem. Meaning, you didn't have any feedback on your writing, so you didn't know how to improve.

No tests at all, just a couple of papers to write. There even aren't many lectures, you usually just work on writing assignments most classes which are pretty easy. For the papers you write, she offers a lot of chances at getting her help which I would really recommend taking. The class is a pretty easy A if you put in minimum effort.
Pretty good teacher. Not too many essays. Not too hard on you. Final Portfolio one of the most important. I would take her again.

There were few given assignments that she would go through with the class to create a mutual interest. Meaning: You will create an assignment with the teacher and classmates whether it's an essay or a video presentations.  In addition to that, if you have any question to clarify on your work, she will openly answer your question and then some.
Great teacher really simple basically talks about social media and very few major assignments but portfolio is big for final
